reviewText:

What a fool I was.

This is surely one of the worst indie games I've ever played. Everything makes me feel now that I've been scammed, betrayed. I absolutely approve the indie game generation (and actually I'm more into them than into triple-A games) but this is a paradigmatical way of let's make something

reviewText: I can't help but feel a little conflicted in recommending this game. I've played games by independent developers that were less buggy, far more polished, and offered way deeper gameplay...and they were free. Everything about this game just reeks of shareware, including the stupid enemy AI, glitched collision detection, horrible physics, and a rudimentary attempt at integrating cover that just doesn't go anywhere. Nevertheless, the original installment of Foreign Legion is one of the better games out there for wave-based stress relief. If you approach it with the idea that you're going to have some brainless fun for a few minutes, and if you abandon the very notion that this game will offer you the slightest bit of challenge or complexity, you can squeeze a few hours of occasional enjoyment out of this title.

reviewText: I played this game for a total of 2 minutes and I realized its true purpose. As a CIA agent I found this game to be a spectacular mechanism of legal torture. I have used this in Afghanistan, Iraq, Ukraine, Syria, and Hoboken NJ. After cleverly sitting a terrorist down in a very friendly manor and coaxing them to play Buckets of Blood, the game does the rest of the work for me. After being attracted to the simplicity of the game, shortly thereafter you are racked by terrible sounds and even worse music. As they mindlessly drone onward through a level they are racked with invisible glitched bad guys and are given no sense of direction. My favorite part is how when you are just about to finish any level, they programmed the game to crash just as you are done, rendering all you've done useless. All I have to say is for $4.99. it's much cheaper than a cloth, bucket of water, rope, chair and time worked from me. This game gets a 10/10. Watch out terrorists Foreign Legion: Buckets of Blood is coming for YOU!

- Repetitive gameplay (shoot, get ammo, repair...)

4.9/10

reviewText:
This game almost feels like it's a parody of something...a total joke. Except it's not funny.
The graphics are obviously designed poorly, the textures are unfinished looking, and the world is boxy and cartoonish, yet the lighting and particles will STILL cause your computer to lag. They skimped on what makes things look pretty, and went heavy on the nasty stuff that just slows down your PC. It's like LEGO graphics, but with more lag.

The game is repetitive and relatively unengaging. Levels can be completed literally by standing in one spot and doing nothing.
Enemies barely present any kind of threat on most difficulties, which is good, because the aim system is so glitchy, the game would become impossible and enormously frustrating if the enemies were made to put up any kind of resistance.

Nevertheless, the game is entertaining...for about 30 minutes.
Defenitely not something I would recomend to anyone.

reviewText:
Foreign Legion, Buckets of Blood is the perfect example of a developer creating a casual game that's not simply a frenzied money grab. Despite being an incredibly simple game, and an incredibly small one at release, the developers have worked hard to improve every single aspect of it.

While the lower difficulties are pretty much impossible to fail on the harder ones provide genuine challenge. The leaderboards and small meta-game will keep the game interesting beyond the initial 30 minutes of excitement.

The LEGO-style graphics are cute but not very pretty and the sounds are about what you'd expect from an indie title.

Probably the most important thing you need to know about this game is how much bigger it has gotten since release. Any review written before the major content updates should be considered invalid because the amount of content that has been added by the developers since release is truly amazing and something that we as gamers should reward in this age of Season Passes.

reviewText:
Good for time-wasting on a smartphone or tablet.

Not good for hours of fun on a PC.

It's a really simple third-person shooter where you defend yourself against invading enemies, earn money for every mission you complete, and buy yourself weapons and accessories. Literally, that's all it is. You can shoot chickens, if that's a redeeming factor to you.

In addition, I think this game is poorly optimized. The requirements aren't too demanding, and yet, my framerate hits below 30 even on Simple graphic settings (you can tell it's a Unity game). Here are my specs:

Windows 8.1 64.bit
AMD A8-6410 Quad Core @ 2.0 GHz
AMD Radeon R5-6410
4 GB RAM

I wouldn't even buy this for $5; I'd rather have this game on my tablet with frequent advertisements for free actually, I wouldn't even buy or download this for free at all, period.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I was admittedly a little disappointed by this game when I played it.  Its actually not really a bad game.  The main problem I have with Foreign Legion: BoB is the mundane repetitiveness of it.  It's fun for like an hour or so, after that the patterns in the gameplay seem to dry out the experience.  This game has an interesting concept and an original visual style, but it really lacks enough content to get you hooked.  I feel like many F2P games out now offer a more thorough, less buggy, and more fulfilling third person shooter experience.  My advice is save your money, but then again at $5 or less its not a stern steer clear, it might be exactly what someone wants.

reviewText:
After playing for little over an hour i have completed all the missions and then you unlock extreme mode and endless mode. There is however replayability in this game. In order to conquer extreme mode i think you would need some of the higher up level guns so you have a small grind to get there of a few hours. Nothing highere than level 20 im at 10 in an hour so there is that.
The levels all playout the same really with small things to change them defend something static and your quite confined to an average size area to do it. There is little bits of cover out there and things to climb for height but there poorly implented and you can just stand in the open if you want to.
There no crouch or prone just stand and jump. No sights just right click and it makes the 3rd person view zoom in a little. Except the sniper rifle but other weapons have sights on them.
But there is an arcade feel to it as you can achieve headshots and blow bodys to pieces for extra points if you want.
The points become cash for all your upgrade some cosmetics ones and some very basic buying of weapons but no customized weapons just as ther come.
It plays nice and graphics are ok at best running in 1080p on fantastic setting the (highest one.
Overall lot of mindless fun to spend on a quick break or mindless afternoon but nothing more. No story no depth just ARCADE FUN.

reviewText:
If you are looking for a fun game to kill an hour or two with, you won't find it here.. Bland gameplay, bland music, bland sound effects even... The game is probably fun for the first mission, and even in the middle of said mission you will spend it wondering when it will end...

The whole point of the game is to make it rain blood, yet it is so unsatisfying that I'd rather just load up Garrys Mod, spawn an army of headcrab zombies on an empty field, then spawn Heavy's minigun and mow them down... That simple activity would be far more entertaining than this whole game, and the thing about Garrys Mod is that what I just talked about is only one of the many things you can do in said game.. Here, however, all you can do is shoot at brainless enemies with rubbish rifles, resisting the urge to aim the rifle at yourself and rid yourself of your painful boredom.

This is not worth the investment, unless you are easily entertained and/or have seriously nothing else to do for the next hour or so...

reviewText:
J'ai profité du Foreign Legion Bundle 9€99 sur Steam pour m'acheter le jeu et au final je pense que c'est une assez bonne affaire, le gameplay est simple et le jeu devient vite corsé en augmentant la difficulté.

Pour ce qui trouvent que le jeu est répétitif, je dirais que cela est normal vu que c'est un jeu bourrin et qu'il faut uniquement tuer des Hordes zombies et/ou terroriste grâce aux nombreuses armes qui vous sont proposés en montant en niveau.

Vous pouvez également jouer jusqu'à quatre, le jeu est excellent entre amis.

Plusieurs arènes sont proposés ainsi qu'un menu de customisation du personnage.

Pas de co-op mais en solo, ce jeu déborde de possibilités et on se laisse vite surprendre à y passer de très nombreuses heures.

15/20

Cons :

So far, I have not found any glitchs or any fun stuff like that. This game is blast! I am quite unsure of the price although, and I think it should be lowered a little bit.
This game was pretty bad except for the non PETA approved chicken level. I suppose that alone made it worth the €1.20 I paid for it.

reviewText:
I purchased this on sale for a little over a dollar. I figured I found a cheap game that would provide me with some hours of fun. Unfortunately, I was wrong. This game wasn't worth the $1 I paid. It most certainly isn't worth the $5 is usually priced at.

Let's roll over the most glaring of negatives here:

- The A.I. is the worst I have experienced in any game. There are games that came out 20 years ago that have better A.I. The enemies are designed to run a set path, every time. They will spawn in the same exact spot, beyond the horizon of which you cannot approach without dying, and will run the same route. If you put yourself smack in the middle of their warpath, they will walk past you to continue on their merry way.

-Many shooters already suffer from a boring plight of uniformity in gameplay. This indie game commits this crime and takes it step further. Each mission has small variations, but you can expect the exact same experience every time. Enemies spawn from afar, you kill them with some headshots, you wait for the next wave. I have more fun chopping wood. Seriously.

-There are a variety of weapons, but only a few that are actually usable. Some accomplish the same thing a more powerful" and expensive weapons does
date: but with higher ammo reserves and less hassle. Do you love shotguns? Me too
recommended: but you won't want to use the one in this game as it does next to nothing without being obscenely close to the enemy
hoursPlayed: all the while being chewed up by the enemy you are approaching. There are very few CQC encounters in this game
votesHelpful:
useless.

The two positive things I have to say about this game:

+It has low hardware requirements. I purchased this to play on my toaster of a laptop. Ran well with only a couple snags.

+There is one level where a giant chicken will fall gracelessly out of the sky when you murder all the regular chickens. Among these regular chickens

reviewText:
One of the stupidest, most poorly made games of all time. On medium, the game looks like garbage but medium is the only graphic setting that works. On high or extremely high it looks like garbage with some better lighting but produces bad flickering. It doesn't matter how good it runs though because it is one of the most poorly made, unfun wastes of time that I have ever seen. I got it somewhere for 50 cents and that was a ripoff. It is the most sadly generic third person shooting humanly imaginable that seemingly uses a game engine from 1990. B.C.

To be fair, you can have about fifteen minutes of laughs until you realize there is nothing to the game besides walking through a predetermined path or guarding something from waves of faceless enemies with the most horribly dry and generic combat that you will ever see in a tps.

Tied with Lovely Planet for worst attempts at a shooter game of all time.

1/10

reviewText: An indie take on 3rd person shooters, with all the cons and little of the pros that come from similar titles. The visuals are iffy despite the attempted art style, the sound effects are generic at best and irritating at worst, and the only saving grace is the gun action that emphasizes some skill, but gets squandered by vague hit-boxes, repetitive goals and dumb-as-brick AI routines and responses. Achievements will keep you playing, but nothing else will after the initial glaze is gone. 2/5

reviewText: Flat gameplay. Monotone animation.
If you like bloody chickens. And huge chickens that shoot eggs out there ♥♥♥ here you go!

After playing this game for 40 minutes, i've had two game-breaking bugs, a severe headache from strobe-shadows and i have no idea what the pause menu says because it's distorted.

The gameplay is simple. Fantastic in its simplicity, but unfortunatley, there is nothing else to back it up.
you rank up to unlock weapons and vanity items, but there's no change in weapon dynamic between piston and assault rifle other than it shoots more bullets.
a headshot is technically a hat-shot as faces count as bodies.
you have to be accurate in your shots, but lack the control to be so at range, I gave up on the sniper rifle when i had to hard-quit the game trying to afford it.

This game could be amazing if there was more of it. It needs to fix the blurry text bug, give a tutorial to the player (some kind of shooting gallery level?) impliment more wepons and, if i were to offer a suggestion to the designers, allow for weapon upgrades that enhance accuracy, damage, clip size etc... nothing too fancy and it doesn't even need to change the graphics, it just needs to make more to work for.

The game needs more weapons, more to work towards, perhaps tertiary weapons like grenades or stationary weapons...
as it stands, three out of five and i'm being generous because of the bugs not being intended.

I hope these issues get fixed and will gladly update this review when it is.

A fun King of the Hill game which sees you play a lone surviving Legionnaire as you defend yourself and your objective from a relentless enemy. The campaign can be easily completed on the same day of purchase but high-score leaderboards, customisation of your Legionnaire, weapon unlocks, and difficulty levels gives the game replayability. Another selling point is that it has one of the most unique boss battles you will probably ever see in video games!
Simple but fun shooter. Well worth the $2 sale price.\n\nGraphics are simplistic, yet at the same time beautiful.

Foreign Legion: Buckets of Blood
This game is so short and poorly made that I feel bad for the developers wasting their time.
This game is awful.

After playing through the game a few times, crushing missions, I got the sense that this is more of an “arcade” type game. The emphasis on high scores and timed missions makes me feel like this game was designed to be played only a little bit at a time. You got ten minutes to kill? Play a mission.

There’s enough here for a casual gamer looking to kill some time, but there doesn’t really seem to be a story here or even the point to level up except for the fact of getting more powerful guns to kill your enemies easier. Other than that, there doesn’t seem to be any real “drive” for me to keep playing. I enjoyed my time playing Buckets of Blood, but I was looking for another game to fill my need to adventure.

http://iamericm.com/2013/05/foreign-legion-buckets-of-blood-indie-game-review-2/
Great game, highly recommended!

This game was on sale for less than $2 so I deciced to get it.

At that price I feel I overpaid.

The game is SHORT.  The game is almost all defense.  The game doesn't want you to precisely aim so it will not let you.

You can finish this game in under 30 mins.  It is a wave" game.  So clear all the waves before the time expires and the scenario will finish.  Even if you complete it in less than half of the time set...

Aiming will P### you the #### off.  There is no "precise" in this game.  The game gives you a general idea of where you are shooting and where the bullet ends up is decided by the program...not where you aim and not your skill.

There is no story.  You enter a scenario and then exit the scenario.  You have a goal
recommended: and you fight off waves of enemies.\n\nField of movement...  You want to aim up?  That's fine...until you realize you aren't allowed to aim as high as you want.  Also
hoursPlayed: there is no running in this game.  The speed you initially move is the speed you will always move.\n\nGraphics...  Fine
voteText: I saw the graphics in the game's store page and knew what I was purchasing.  But when aiming/looking up I had my screen/vision blocked by the object behind me?  That is bad programming.  How could the programmers overlook the fact that the "camera" can be obscured by objects near the player character?  That is not only bad programming but lazy programming.\n\nIf this game is ever less than 99 cents...I would say "buy it".  But at the price it is currently at?  AVOID THIS GAME.  IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY."

reviewText: After the develepor added some more modes, guns, etc. (and dropped the price) this is actually a fairly decent run-and-gun.\n\nThe controls take a bit of getting used to, but it is still pretty ok for some mindless fun.
The game is weak.\nI do not recommend it.

This game has a very short campaign, but for being an inexpensive as it is, I suppose you can't complain.  The story will take you about an hour and a half to do, about another hour for all the Steam achievements.  It's fun while it lasts though, in a simple kind of way.
This game is amazing, with amazing replay value. Get it. now.

A decent $5 third person shooter game with a very simple gameplay, kill enemies, collect money and experience, buy new weapons, play next stage - yada yada. Don't expect any serious gameplay. If you're like I've got 10 minutes break from work and I want to shoot something." this game is just for you."
Why did I buy this?\n\nI don't even know.
The game falls short of developing any charisma below the surface and lacks the ability to remain fun for anymore than a brief period of time.

A fun little lego man esk fps, simple gameplay but fun.
Few weapons and difficulties to choose from to keep it from getting stale, the same could be said for outfits.
Game also has fun little easter eggs.
The game also doesnt have hard achievements so if your an achievement hunter it is worth a look at for some quick achievements.
The game missions are pretty cool to, they do vary from defend an area, to escort and just survive.
The game is pretty short but is good for killing time or if your bored from your main game i.e. dota 2, tf2 etc

5/10 simple and short but a good laugh :D
Mindless shooting with quite a bit of replay value, but it's still no Smash TV.

With so many indie games in the market it's hard to find one that really is bang for your buck. I purchased this game at $2 during a sale on Steam, and I will say it's worth it's weight in gold. The cartoonish feel with the upgrade-style gameplay makes this game very enjoyable. The levels are pretty quick to complete, but can be challenging during the later levels. Anyone that enjoys a good clean shooter to waste time, and that doesn't have much room on their harddrive, or even doesn't have a good graphics card should pick this game up.

This is in no way a great game...
However, it's silly mindless fun and if you can get it at a sale price it's a bargain :0)

Nice little game for 5 bucks that most computers can run. Bloodier than I imagined, and a bit more difficult than you'd expect. I recommend this if you just want a cheap game for mild excitement. It isn't that good if you want a full-fledged campaign. There is no story mode, no online. You have no clue what you're doing most of the time, but this is still a solid little game. 8/10

A way fun 3rd Person Shooter! This game can go far in the future if they decide to improve it some more. The graphics are very simple and great to look at. The gameplay is not hard to learn and get used to. The game doesn't take long to beat and get all the Steam Achievements. Its a wonderful game that was very enjoyable all the way to the end. If you love shooters then this is one not to miss out on. This is a great humorous game that puts alot of joy into shooting the enemy. There is not a multiplayer in this game but when they do involve it then this is a must buy because its going to be a hoot to play. There is a massive chicken you have to fight as a boss fight which is funny to fight. I loved playing this game! If you are considering getting it then dont hesitate any further and get it and i know you would enjoy it if you gave it a decent chance.

A simple game filled with mindless fun, but held back by some weird flaws. The difficulty scales poorly, making you feel like grinding on lower difficulties for unlocks. The controls are weird, and the weapons don't seem to hit properly, making accurate shots feel like flukes more than anything. Cleaned up and it would be a lot better. As is, might as well just go back to Crimsonlands.
